snippet: Some residents of Buenos Aires described an archbishop who had worked hard to change the lives of the poor, but others said he had done too little to challenge the country’s former dictatorship.
abstract: Celebration of Pope Francis in his native Argentina is tempered by complaints from some critics of his hard-line conservative views on range of subjects, including gay rights and artistic expression.

byline.contributor: William Neuman, Emily Schmall and Jonathan Gilbert contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Some residents of Buenos Aires described an archbishop who had worked hard to change the lives of the poor, but others said he had done too little to challenge the country’s former dictatorship.

headline.seo: Argentines Divide Over Selection of Pope Francis
headline.main: Back Home a Pontiff Is Honored, if Not by All
headline.print_headline: Back Home A Pontiff Is Honored, If Not by All
